intro: Hirculus nutans, commonly known as the nodding hirculus, is a flowering plant characterized by its unique inflorescence. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, hairy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in a drooping arrangement that gives it its common name. Hirculus nutans is native to temperate regions and is often found in moist, shady environments.
